result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Pollard

records.addlTxt: Registered mail card returned signed by Loretta Roberts.
to forfeit bond

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: bench warrant - in state only.
from DA Nordin requesting warrant be amended to "In Wisconsin Only". Court amends warrant to In Wisconsin Only.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers has no information of defendants whereabouts. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Kevin L Pollard appears by phone along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates matter is resolved, asks court to set a plea/sentencing date. Defendant needs 2 - 3 weeks to make arrangements to get back to Wisconsin.  Court removes trial from the calendar, sets a plea/sentencing date. If defendant doesn't appear in person on that day, court may be issuing a warrant for his arrest. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that assistant sends out notice, unsure if that happened, advises that Defendant was adamant about going to trial last time they spoke. Atty Gerbers is unsure if Defendant is aware of today's date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from DA Pelrine opposing the lifting of the no contact between defendant and victim.
No contact modification request from victim.  Court denies request to amend bond.
Jury trial on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2016 at 11:15 am.
State Exh. 1 - statement from victim. Offered and received.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Set for pre-trial and trial. Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Kevin L Pollard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Derek Jennerjohn testifies, sworn. State Exh. 1 - statement from victim take by Officer Jennerjohn. Offered and received. Cross. Court finds probable cause that felony was committed and probable cause that defendant committed that felony and binds over for further proceedings.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defendant was fingerprinted on 4/15/16.
Preliminary hearing on April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
by Nicole Harrold.

Defendant Kevin L Pollard in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, requests prelim. within 10 day  time limit. Bond remains in effect.
No contact direct or indirect with K.S. or her residence.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Kevin L Pollard appear by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 4/18/16 at 10:00 am.
